documentType.label: other
reasons: Document is a marketing/brochure page for MetLife Long-Term Care product (not an invoice, CMR, or UB04).
Contains product name, plan summaries, and rider descriptions typical of an insurance brochure.

fields.name: Plan Type
fields.value: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)

fields.name: Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA) Options
fields.value: MBA options: $3K, $6K, $9K, $12K, $15K. TBA options: $75K, $100K, $200K, $300K, $400K, $500K, $1MM* (*$1MM not available with Cash Benefit Rider).

fields.name: Optional Riders Available
fields.value: Shared Care Rider: Insured and spouse/partner can access each other's benefits once TBA under their own policy is exhausted; when insured dies remaining TBA transfers to spouse/partner at no extra cost. Nonforfeiture Rider: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment or is cancelled by insured; must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when policy ends; provides full MBA and reduced TBA equal to the greater of total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA; available at initial application only. Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment instead of reimbursement for covered services; available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available; benefits may be taxable.

fields.name: Guaranteed Purchase Option (GPO)
fields.value: Included with Simple Advantage only. Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years to age 65 with no additional underwriting; premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates; lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; increases will not occur if insured is eligible for benefits.

fields.name: Benefit Increase Options
fields.value: Available with Custom Advantage only. Future Purchase Option (FPO): increases MBA and remaining portion of TBA automatically by 5% of the MBA/remaining TBA each year if elected; increases occur unless insurer rejects in writing; corresponding increase in premium; if insurer rejects twice in a row, insured will no longer receive automatic increases but can request to have offer reinstated. Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of TBA in effect at end of previous policy year by either 3% or 5% with corresponding premium increase; 3% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider and 5% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider available.

fields.name: Footer Notice
fields.value: FOR PRODUCER OR BROKER/DEALER USE ONLY. NOT FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION. Metropolitan Life Insurance Company (MetLife)
